20.name: Paper Craft Camera
20.desc: This was a Illustrator project for my Image Design class at The New England Institute of Art.  I had a little too much fun with this project, making sure to put in as much detail as possible.

22.name: NeighbFav
22.desc: Neighbfav is a startup where you can get things delivered by friends or neighbors. This was the first startup web company I worked for, and it was a wonderful learning experience. I worked on some of the design for the site and the mobile app and helped with the front-end development.

23.name: MSCA
23.desc: I developed this site hand-writing HTML and CSS for the Massachusetts Sudanese Community Association.  I also designed the website and logo to adhere to the communities i

26.name: Bottol
26.desc:
Bottol.com, an online message sharing and tracking tool, hired me
to re-design the webstie. It was a fun project to work on and allowed
me to improve my UX skills because it was important that all elements of the design were intuitive and cohesive.

27.name: Izuly
27.desc: I was hired through ElefhantWorks to design and develop Izuly.com. The site helped me gain experience learning the Big Cartel templating API and integrating it with a custom Wordpress theme. It was also a fun, feminine site to design.

30.name: John Sullivan Law
30.desc:
John Sullivan is a Massachusetts lawyer and I was hired through ElefhantWorks to 
create an celtic style website that was both clean and professional. The site is 
a custom Wordpress theme.

31.name: Gliacure
31.desc: I was contracted through Spin350 to develop the desktop and mobile Wordpress theme for gliacure.com. Working on this project gave me more experience developing Wordpress widgets and plugins.

32.name: Calorie Infographic
32.desc: A project for Information Architecture at The New England Institute of art. I found bizarre calorie-burning activities and calculated what foods they would burn off. All of the graphics were created in Illustrator and are available for free download in my goodies section.

33.name: AiMe
33.desc: This was a project for my Mobile Design and Development course at The New England Institute of Art. The mobile site was developed using jQueryMobile.

34.name: Timer Interface
34.desc: This is a high fidelity prototype that was developed for my Interface Design class.

35.name: Fast Food Memory
35.desc: This memory game was my midterm project for my Advanced Actionscript class at The New England Institute of Art. The elements were designed using Illustrator and the project was developed with Actionscript.

36.name: Localytics
36.desc: I've been working with Localytics, part-time on both their marketing and client-facing sites. I designed and developed the mobile version of the marketing site, designed web banner adds, created landing and informational pages and help design and implement some new features.

37.name: Information Architecture Infog
37.desc: For my final Information Architecture Project, I created a infographic on Information Architecture in the form of a blueprint. It was all created using Illustrator.
